cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

foreignNames.name: Llanowarelfen
foreignNames.text:
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um G.
Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber.

cards.originalText: ocT: Add oG to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

foreignNames.name: Lord von Atlantis
foreignNames.text: Alles Meervolk erhält +1/+1 und die Fähigkeit Inseltarnung.

cards.originalText: All Merfolk in play gain islandwalk and +1/+1 while this card is in play.

cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

rulings.text: If you control any other creatures as Lord of the Pit’s triggered ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. You can’t choose to be dealt 7 damage instead.

If Lord of the Pit has gained lifelink, being dealt 7 damage by it doesn’t cause your life total to change, even though you gain and lose life. If your life total is less than 7, you won’t lose the game.
If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

foreignNames.name: Fürst der Unterwelt
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen und verursacht Trampelschaden
Opfere während Deiner Versorgungsphase eine Deiner eigenen Kreaturen. Wenn Du keine Kreatur opfern kannst, fügt Dir der Fürst der Unterwelt 7 Schadenspunkte zu. Du kannst den Fürsten der Unterwelt nicht sich selbst opfern.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
You must sacrifice one of your own creatures during your upkeep or Lord of the Pit does 7 damage to you. You may still attack with Lord of the Pit even if you failed to sacrifice a creature. Lord of the Pit may not be sacrificed to itself.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

rulings.text: Lure doesn’t give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that’s tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can’t block doesn’t block. If there’s a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn’t block if that cost isn’t paid.

foreignNames.name: Köder
foreignNames.text: Alle Kreaturen, die die verzauberte Kreatur blocken können, müssen dies tun. Köder verhindert nicht, dass Kreaturen, die die Eigenschaft haben, mehrere Kreaturen zu blocken, dies auch tun. Wenn der Blocker gezwungen ist, mehr Kreaturen zu blocken, als ihn möglich ist, darf der Verteidiger sich aussuchen, welche der Kreaturen geblockt wird, doch müssen so viele Kreaturen wie erlaubt geblockt werden.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can’t change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as “Island Fish Jasconius”.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
It can be used to change a land’s type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn’t change the name of any permanent.

foreignNames.name: Kupferstecher
foreignNames.text: Ändere den Text einer Karte Deiner Wahl, die gerade gespielt wird oder bereits im Spiel ist, indem Du ein Basisland durch ein beliebiges anderes ersetzt. Du kannst so zum Beispiel "Sumpftarnung" durch "Ebenentarnung" ersetzen.

cards.originalText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one basic land type with another. For example, you can change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk."

cards.name: Magnetic Mountain
cards.text:
Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures they control and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

foreignNames.name: Magnetberg
foreignNames.text: Blaue Kreaturen können nicht enttappt werden. Während ihrer Versorgungsphase müssen die Spieler für jede blaue Kreatur, die sie enttappen wollen, 4 zahlen -und zwar zusätzlich zu allen anderen Aktivierungskosten, die für diese blaue Kreatur bereits verlangt werden.

cards.originalText: Blue creatures do not untap as normal. During their upkeep phases, players must spend o4 for each blue creature they wish to untap. This cost must be paid in addition to any other untap cost a given blue creature may already require.

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

foreignNames.name: Mahamoti-Dschinn
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Mana Flare
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced.

rulings.text: When used with lands that can produce multiple colors, Mana Flare produces one additional mana of the same color that was produced. It can’t give a mana of a color that wasn’t produced.
Only produces extra mana when land is tapped for mana, not when tapped by some other effect.
If the land produces more than one color of mana at a single time, its controller chooses which of those types is produced by Mana Flare’s ability.
This is a triggered mana ability.
Mana Flare adds one of whatever color the land produces after applying any land type or color changing effects.
The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
Does not copy any restrictions on the mana, such as with Mishra’s Workshop or Pillar of the Paruns.
Produces only one additional mana, regardless of how much was produced by tapping the land.

foreignNames.name: Manasegen
foreignNames.text: Wann immer einer der Spieler ein Land wegen Mana tappt, erhält er 1 weiteres Mana des gleichen Typs.

cards.originalText: Whenever either player taps a land for mana, it produces 1 extra mana of the appropriate type.

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and that player loses all unspent mana.

rulings.text: It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.

foreignNames.name: Manamangel
foreignNames.text: Alle Gelände des Gegners werden getappt und sein Manavorrat geleert.

cards.originalText: All opponent's lands are tapped, and opponent's mana pool is emptied. Opponent takes no damage from unspent mana.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.

foreignNames.name: Manaschatz
foreignNames.text:
Der Manaschatz enttappt nicht normal während Deiner Enttap-Phase. Wenn er während Deiner Versorgungsphase getappt bleibt, fügt er Dir einen Schadenspunkt zu.
{4}: Enttappe Manaschatz. Du kannst diese Fähigkeit nur während Deiner Versorgungsphase benützen.
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um 3 farblose Mana. Behandle diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungs-zauber.

cards.originalText: ocT: Add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Mana Vault doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must pay 4 mana during your upkeep. If Mana Vault remains tapped during upkeep it does 1 damage to you. Drawing mana from this artifact is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

rulings.text: This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.

If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs’s ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it’s put on the stack, then Manabarbs’s triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.

On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

foreignNames.name: Manahaken
foreignNames.text: Jedesmal, wenn ein Land getappt wird, um den Manavorrat aufzustocken, fügt Manahaken dem Beherrscher des Landes 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: Whenever mana is drawn from a land, Manabarbs does 1 damage to the land's controller.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

foreignNames.name: Stein der Sanftmut
foreignNames.text: Keine Kreatur mit einer Stärke größer als 2 kann während der Enttap-Phase enttappt werden.

cards.originalText: Any creature with power greater than 2 may not be untapped as normal during the untap phase.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

foreignNames.name: Mesa-Pegasus
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen, Bündnisfähigkeit

cards.originalText: Flying, bands

cards.name: Mijae Djinn
cards.text: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.

rulings.text: The coin flip is done as a triggered ability on declaring the Djinn as an attacker.
If the Djinn attacks, but you lose the coin toss, then it is still considered to have attacked, and any other abilities that trigger on it attacking will resolve normally.
Any abilities which have already resolved before the coin flip are not undone. Any abilities that trigger when it attacks which have not already resolved will still resolve.

foreignNames.name: Mijae-Dschinn
foreignNames.text: Wenn Du mit dem Mijae-Dschinn angreifen willst, musst Du eine Münze werfen, sobald Du Deinen Angriff angekündigt hast. Dein Gegner sagt Kopf oder Zahl an. Gewinnt er, dann greift der Mijae-Dschinn nicht an, wird aber trotzdem getappt.

cards.originalText: If you choose to attack with Mijae Djinn, flip a coin immediately after attack is announced; opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in opponent's favor, Mijae Djinn is tapped but does not attack.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player mills two cards.
cards.flavor: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

foreignNames.name: Mühlstein
foreignNames.text: 2, {T}: Nimm die obersten beiden Karten von der Bibliothek eines Spielers und lege sie direkt auf dessen Friedhof.

cards.originalText: o2, ocT: Take the top two cards from target player's library and put them in target player's graveyard.

cards.name: Mind Twist
cards.text: Target player discards X cards at random.

foreignNames.name: Wahnsinn
foreignNames.text: Ein Spieler Deiner Wahl muß X zufällig ausgesuchte Karten aus seiner Hand abwerfen. Hat er nicht genug Karten, dann muß er alle seine Karten abwerfen.

cards.originalText: Opponent must discard X cards at random from hand. If opponent doesn't have enough cards in hand, entire hand is discarded.

cards.name: Mishra's War Machine
cards.text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

rulings.text: You may choose to take damage or to discard. You can’t avoid taking damage if you have no cards to discard.

If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

foreignNames.name: Mishras Kriegsmaschine
foreignNames.text:
Hat Bündnisfähigkeit
Wirf während Deiner Versorgungsphase eine Karte Deiner Wahl aus Deinem Blatt ab. Andernfalls wird Mishras Kampfmaschine getappt und fügt Dir 3 Schadenspunkte zu.

cards.originalText:
Bands
During your upkeep, discard one card of your choice from your hand, or Mishra's War Machine becomes tapped and does 3 points of damage to you.

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oR to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oR to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oR to your mana pool.

cards.name: Nether Shadow
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: Since it enters the battlefield due to triggering at the beginning of upkeep, it is not possible to get an infinite loop with four Nether Shadows.
Note that bringing the Shadow back onto the battlefield from the graveyard is not a spell, it is an ability. It can’t be countered with something that counters spells.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it’s put into its owner’s graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

Say you’re the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that’s attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma’s Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they’re put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it’s put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.
A card is “above” another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.

foreignNames.name: Niederschatten
foreignNames.text: Liegt der Schatten am Ende Deiner Versorgungsphase auf Deinem Friedhof und liegen noch mindestens drei Kreaturen über ihm, kannst Du ihn ins Spiel zurückbringen. Der Schatten kann in derselben Runde angreifen, in der er heraufbeschworen oder ins Spiel zurückgekehrt ist.

cards.originalText: If Shadow is in graveyard with any combination of cards above it that includes at least three creatures, it can be returned to play during your upkeep. Shadow can attack on same turn summoned or returned to play.

cards.name: Nettling Imp
cards.text: {T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step if it didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.

rulings.text: If the Imp leaves the battlefield before the end of the turn, the creature still is destroyed.
You can use this effect on a creature you know won’t be able to attack. For example, you can use it on a tapped creature.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can’t do so legally.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

foreignNames.name: Quälbold
foreignNames.text: Zwinge eine Nicht-Mauer-Kreatur Deines Gegners zum Angriff. Kann diese Kreatur nicht angreifen, stirbt sie am Ende des Zuges. Diese Fähigkeit kannst Du nur während des Zuges Deines Gegners anwenden, und zwar noch vor dessen Angriffsphase. Kreaturen, die erst während dieses Zuges heraufbeschworen wurden und somit unter Einsatzverzögerung leiden, können nicht zum Angriff gezwungen werden.

cards.originalText: ocT: Force a particular one of opponent's non-wall creatures to attack. If target creature cannot attack, it is killed at end of turn. This ability can only be used during opponent's turn, before the attack. May not be used on creatures summoned this turn.

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

rulings.text: You don’t sacrifice Nevinyrral’s Disk to activate its ability. It’s destroyed as part of the ability’s resolution if it’s still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral’s Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it stays on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Nevinyrrals Wunderscheibe
foreignNames.text:
Kommt bereits getappt ins Spiel.
1, {T}: Zerstöre alle Kreaturen, Verzauberungen und Artefakte im Spiel einschließlich der Wunderscheibe selbst.

cards.originalText: o1: Destroys all creatures, enchantments, and artifacts in play, including Disk itself. Disk begins tapped but can be untapped as usual.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

foreignNames.name: Nachtmahr
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Stärke und Widerstandskraft des Nachtmahrs entsprechen der Anzahl der Sümpfe, die der Beherrscher im Spiel hat.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness both equal the number of swamps its controller has in play.

cards.name: Northern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
cards.flavor: "Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort." —The Book of Tal

foreignNames.name: Nordischer Paladin
foreignNames.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Vernichte eine schwarze bleibende Karte.

cards.originalText: oWoW, ocT: Destroys a black card in play. Cannot be used to cancel a black spell as it is being cast.

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone..."
—*Song of the Artificer*

cards.name: Onulet
cards.text: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

foreignNames.name: Opfertisch
foreignNames.text: Sobald dieser erfolgreich beschworene Opfertisch auf dem Friedhof landet, erhältst Du 2 Lebenspunkte.

cards.originalText: If Onulet is placed in the graveyard, its controller gains 2 life.

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability doesn’t resolve because the target is illegal.

foreignNames.name: Ork-Artillerie
foreignNames.text: {T}: Die Ork-Artillerie fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl 2 Schadenspunkte zu, Dir selbst jedoch 3 Schadenspunkte.

cards.originalText: ocT: Orcish Artillery does 2 damage to any target, but it also does 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

foreignNames.name: Standarte der Orks
foreignNames.text: Alle angreifenden Kreaturen unter Deiner Kontrolle erhalten +1/+0.

cards.originalText: During your attack, all of your attacking creatures gain +1/+0.

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

foreignNames.name: Ornithopter
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Paralyze
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If the player does, untap the creature.

rulings.text: Paying the cost is optional.
Paralyze can be cast targeting a creature which is already tapped.
The creature can only be untapped using Paralyze once per turn.
Two Paralyzes are not cumulative. Paying either one will untap the creature.
This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Paralyze itself has the last triggered ability, rather than granting that ability to the enchanted creature.

foreignNames.name: Lähmung
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur kann nicht während der Entap-Phase normal enttappt werden. Der Beherrscher der Kreatur muß in der Versorgungsphase 4 bezahlen, um sie zu enttappen. Tappe die Kreatur, wenn die Lähmung auf sie gesprochen wird.

cards.originalText: Target creature is not untapped as normal during untap phase. Creature's controller may spend o4 during his or her upkeep to untap it. Tap target creature when Paralyze is cast.

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent’s Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

foreignNames.name: Eigene Inkarnation
foreignNames.text: Der Beherrscher kann Teile oder den ganzen Schaden, der der Inkarnation zugefügt wird, auf sich selber umleiten. Wird die Inkarnation vernichtet, verliert ihr Beherrscher die (aufgerundete) Hälfte seiner Lebenspunkte. Effekte, die Schaden verhindern oder umleiten, können hier nicht angewendet werden, um diesen Verlust an Lebenspunkten zu verhindern.

cards.originalText: Caster can redirect any or all damage done to Personal Incarnation to self instead. The source of the damage is unchanged. If Personal Incarnation goes to the graveyard, caster loses half his or her remaining life points, rounding up the loss.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

foreignNames.name: Der Schwarze Tod
foreignNames.text:
Sollten am Ende eines Spielzuges keine Kreaturen mehr im Spiel sein, geht der schwarze Tod auf den Fiedhof.
{B}: Der schwarze Tod verursacht 1 Schadenspunkt bei allen Kreaturen und allen Spielern.

cards.originalText:
ooB Do 1 damage to each creature and to both players.
If there are no creatures in play at the end of any turn, Pestilence must be discarded.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

foreignNames.name: Traumkrieger
foreignNames.text:
Können fliegen.
Zahle während Deiner Versorgungsphase {U} oder zerstöre die Traumkrieger.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Controller must spend oU during upkeep to maintain or Phantasmal Forces are destroyed.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

foreignNames.name: Reich der Illusionen
foreignNames.text: Verzaubere ein Land in ein Standardland Deiner Wahl.

cards.originalText: Target land changes to any basic land type of caster's choice. Land type is set when cast and may not be further altered by this card.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: "While, like a ghastly rapid river, Through the pale door, A hideous throng rush out forever, And laugh—but smile no more." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

foreignNames.name: Phantommonster
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to any target.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.

foreignNames.name: Piratenschiff
foreignNames.text:
Das Piratenschiff kann nur angreifen, wenn der Gegner Inseln im Spiel hat. Wenn Du zu irgendeiner Zeit keine Inseln mehr im Spiel hast, begrabe das Piratenschiff.
{T}: Füge einem beliebigen Ziel 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText:
ocT: Do 1 damage to any target.
Cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still use special ability. Pirate Ship is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Plague Rats
cards.text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Should you a Rat to madness tease Why ev'n a Rat may plague you. . ." —Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

foreignNames.name: Pestratten
foreignNames.text: Pestratten haben soviel Stärke und Widerstandskraft wie Pestratten im Spiel sind, egal unter wessen Kontrolle. Wenn beispielsweise zwei Pestratten im Spiel sind, haben beide Stärke und Widerstandskraft 2/2.

cards.originalText: The *s below are the number of Plague Rats in play, counting both sides. Thus if there are two Plague Rats in play, each has power and toughness 2/2.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oW to your mana pool.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oW to your mana pool.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oW to your mana pool.

cards.name: Plateau
cards.text: ({T}: Add {R} or {W}.)

rulings.text: This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn’t a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don’t affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

foreignNames.name: Plateau
foreignNames.text: {T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um {R} oder {W}. Diese Karte zählt als Gebirge und als Ebene und unterliegt Zaubersprüchen, die für diese beiden Standard-Länder gelten. Zerstört ein Zauberspruch einen dieser Standard-Länder, wird diese Karte zerstört; verändert ein Zauberspruch eines dieser Standard-Länder, bleibt das andere Standard-Land davon unberührt.

cards.originalText:
ocT: Add either oR or oW to your mana pool.
Counts as both mountains and plains and is affected by spells that affect either. If a spell destroys one of these land types, this card is destroyed; if a spell alters one of these land types, the other land type is unaffected.

cards.name: Power Leak
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.

foreignNames.name: Kraftleck
foreignNames.text: Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers der verzauberten Verzauberung fügt das Kraftleck diesem 2 Schadenspunkte zu. Dieser Spieler kann 1 pro Schadenspunkt, den er vermeiden will, ausgeben, um sich vor dem Kraftleck zu schützen.

cards.originalText: Target enchantment costs 2 extra mana during the upkeep phase of each of its controller's turns. If target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, Power Leak does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not “tapped for mana”. If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

foreignNames.name: Kraftverlust
foreignNames.text: Der Zielspruch wird neutralisiert, wenn dessen Urheber nicht sofort X ausgibt. Er muß alles verfügbare Mana aus seinem Manavorrat und seinen Ländern ausgeben, bis X bezahlt ist; wenn benötigt, kann er auch andere Manaquellen heranziehen.

cards.originalText: Target spell is countered unless its caster spends X more mana. Caster of target spell must draw and spend all available mana from lands and mana pool until X is spent; he or she may also spend mana from other sources if desired. If this is not enough mana, target spell will still be countered.

cards.name: Power Surge
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Power Surge deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands they controlled at the beginning of this turn.

rulings.text: This card knows how many were untapped even if it was not on the battlefield at the beginning of the turn.

foreignNames.name: Stromstoß
foreignNames.text: Der Stromstoß fügt jedem Spieler während seiner Versorgungsphase für jedes Land, dass zu Beginn seines Zuges (also vor der Enttap-Phase) nicht getappt war, einen Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of a player's turn, before the untap phase, the player must take a counter for each of his or her lands that is not tapped. During the player's upkeep, Power Surge does 1 damage to that player for each counter; the counters are then discarded.

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

rulings.text: In zones other than the battlefield, this creature card is 0/0.

If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won’t necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
If a creature that’s already on the battlefield becomes a copy of this creature, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for this creature as it entered the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Urlehmgestalt
foreignNames.text: Wenn Du die Lehmgestalten formst, musst Du Dich entscheiden: Entweder erschaffst Du eine 1/6 Mauer oder eine 3/3 Kreatur oder eine 2/2 Kreatur mit Flugfähigkeit.

cards.originalText: When you cast Primal Clay, you must choose whether to make it a 1/6 wall, a 3/3 creature, or a 2/2 flying creature. Primal Clay then remains in this form until altered by another card or removed from play.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

foreignNames.name: Abtrünniger Zauberer
foreignNames.text: {T}: Fügt einem beliebigen Ziel 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: ocT: Do 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

foreignNames.name: Seelengift
foreignNames.text: Wenn das verzauberte Land getappt wird, fügt das Seelengift dessen Beherrscher 2 Schadenspunkte zu.

cards.originalText: Whenever target land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom does 2 damage to target land's controller.

cards.name: Purelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

foreignNames.name: Reinheitsgewebe
foreignNames.text: Die Farbe einer entweder sich im Spiel befindlichen oder gerade gespielten Karte verändert sich in Weiß. Völlig unberührt davon bleiben der Gebrauch einer bestimmten Fähigkeit und die Kosten der Heraufbeschwörung, des Tappens oder der Versorgung des Ziels.

cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to white. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

foreignNames.name: Auferstehung der Toten
foreignNames.text: Nimm eine Kreaturenkarte Deiner Wahl aus Deinem Friedhof auf Deine Hand.

cards.originalText: Bring one creature from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Reconstruction
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

foreignNames.name: Wiederherstellung
foreignNames.text: Hole ein Artefakt vom Friedhof zurück in Dein Blatt.

cards.originalText: Bring one artifact from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Red Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.
• Destroy target blue permanent.

foreignNames.name: Roter Urknall
foreignNames.text: Neutralisiert einen blauen Zauberspruch oder zerstört eine blaue Karte im Spiel.

cards.originalText: Counters a blue spell being cast or destroys a blue card in play.

cards.name: Red Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

foreignNames.name: Roter Schutz
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält Schutz gegen Rot. Dieser Schutz zerstört allerdings diese Verzauberung nicht.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from red.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

foreignNames.name: Regeneration
foreignNames.text: {G}: Regeneriere die durch diesen Zauber verzauberte Kreatur.

cards.originalText: ooG Target creature regenerates.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

foreignNames.name: Neues Leben
foreignNames.text: Hole von Deinem Friedhof eine Karte Deiner Wahl wieder in Dein Blatt.

cards.originalText: Bring any card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Resurrection
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Wiederauferstehung
foreignNames.text: Nimm eine Kreatur aus Deinem Friedhof und bringe sie direkt ins Spiel. Behandle sie so, als ob sie gerade beschworen worden wäre.

cards.originalText: Take a creature from your graveyard and put it directly into play. Treat this creature as though it were just summoned.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

foreignNames.name: Umkehrschaden
foreignNames.text: Aller Schaden, den Du bislang in diesem Zug von einer bestimmten Quelle erhalten hast, wird zu Deinem Lebenspunkten hinzuaddiert statt abgezogen. Wenn Du in diesem Zug noch weiteren Schaden aus dieser Quelle erhältst, wird dieser ganz normal behandelt.

cards.originalText: All damage you have taken from any one source this turn is added to your life total instead of subtracted from it.

cards.name: Reverse Polarity
cards.text: You gain X life, where X is twice the damage dealt to you so far this turn by artifacts.

foreignNames.name: Umgekehrte Polarität
foreignNames.text: Jeder Schadenspunkt, der Dir bis jetzt in diesem Zug von Artefakten zugefügt wurde, verwandelt sich rückwirkend in einen Lebenspunkt, den Du zu Deinen dazuaddierst. Weiterer Schaden, den Du diese Runde erhältst, wird ganz normal behandelt.

cards.originalText: All damage done to you by artifacts so far this turn is retroactively added to your life total instead of subtracted. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A “blocking creature” is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

foreignNames.name: Rechtschaffenheit
foreignNames.text: Ein blockende Kreatur Deiner Wahl erhält +7/+7 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText: Target defending creature gains +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Roc of Kher Ridges
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders toppled from its perch and sprouted gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.

foreignNames.name: Vogel Roc aus dem Khergebirge
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Rock Hydra
cards.text:
Rock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.
{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: If put onto the battlefield without casting it from your hand, X will be zero.
Once on the battlefield, the X is considered to be zero when calculating its mana cost.

You can activate the activated ability that prevents damage any time, even if no source seems likely to deal damage to you in the near future. It will prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt this turn, even if that turns out to be much later in the turn.
If damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra can’t be prevented, you still remove a +1/+1 counter from it for each 1 damage dealt.

foreignNames.name: Felsenhydra
foreignNames.text:
Lege X +1/+1-Marker (als Köpfe der Hydra) auf die Karte.
Jeder Schadenspunkt gegen die Hydra zerstört einen ihrer Köpfe, wenn Du nicht pro Kopf {R} ausgibst.
Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers können neue Köpfe zum Preis von RRR pro Kopf nachwachsen.

cards.originalText: Put X +1/+1 counters (heads) on Hydra. Each point of damage Hydra suffers kills one head unless controller spends oR per head. During controller's upkeep, new heads may be grown for oRoRoR apiece.

cards.name: Rocket Launcher
cards.text: {2}: Rocket Launcher deals 1 damage to any target. Destroy Rocket Launcher at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only if you've controlled Rocket Launcher continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.
cards.flavor: What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.

rulings.text: You can choose different targets for each use.
Because it does not have tapping as part of its activation cost, you can activate the ability many times in one turn, but it is destroyed at the end of any turn in which you use it.
It is only destroyed at end of turn if the ability resolved. If the ability is countered, it is not sacrificed.

foreignNames.name: Raketenwerfer
foreignNames.text:
{2}: Füge einem beliebigen Ziel 1 Schadenspunkt zu. Du kannst den Raketenwerfer erst verwenden, sobald er einmal zu Beginn Deines Zuges im Spiel gewesen ist.
Der Raketenwerfer wird nach Benutzung am Ende Deines Zuges zerstört.

cards.originalText: o2: Do 1 damage to any target. Rocket Launcher may not be used until it begins a turn in play on your side. If it is used, Rocket Launcher is destroyed at end of turn.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.

foreignNames.name: Stab des Verderbens
foreignNames.text: 3, {T}: Der Stab des Verderbens fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: o3, ocT: Rod of Ruin does 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, the royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can’t target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin’s ability resolves, then the ability doesn’t resolve.

foreignNames.name: Meistermeuchler
foreignNames.text: {T}: Zerstöre eine getappte Kreatur.

cards.originalText: ocT: Destroy any tapped creature.

cards.name: Sacrifice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: Sacrificing an animated land gives no mana since the converted mana cost was zero.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

foreignNames.name: Opferung
foreignNames.text: Opfere eine Deiner Kreaturen und erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um schwarzes Mana in Höhe der Beschwörungskosten der geopferten Kreatur.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice one of your creatures to add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to that creature's casting cost.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

foreignNames.name: Feldscher
foreignNames.text: {T}: Verhinderte einen Schadenspunkt bei einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler.

cards.originalText: ocT: Prevent 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Savannah
cards.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {W}.)

rulings.text: This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn’t a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don’t affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

foreignNames.name: Savanne
foreignNames.text:
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um {W} oder {G}.
Diese Karte zählt als Ebene und als Wald und unterliegt Zaubersprüchen, die für diese beiden Standard-Länder gelten. Zerstört ein Zauberspruch eines dieser Standard-Länder, wird diese Karte zerstört; verändert ein Zauberspruch eines dieser Standardländer, bleibt das andere Standard-Land davon unberührt.

cards.originalText:
ocT: Add either oW or oG to your mana pool.
Counts as both plains and forest and is affected by spells that affect either. If a spell destroys one of these land types, this card is destroyed; if a spell alters one of these land types, the other land type is unaffected.

cards.name: Savannah Lions
cards.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Scavenging Ghoul
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

rulings.text: The Ghoul still gets to claim counters even if it enters the battlefield after the creatures died.

foreignNames.name: Leichenfledderer
foreignNames.text:
Lege am Ende jedes Zuges für jede Kreatur, die in diesem Zug vernichtet wurde, eine Leichen-Spielmarke auf den Ghoul.
0: Entferne eine Leichenmarke, um den Ghoul zu regenerieren.

cards.originalText: At the end of each turn, put one counter on Ghoul for each other creature that was placed in the graveyard during the turn. If Ghoul takes lethal damage, you may use a counter to regenerate it; counters remain until used.

cards.name: Scrubland
cards.text: ({T}: Add {W} or {B}.)

rulings.text: This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn’t a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don’t affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

foreignNames.name: Buschland
foreignNames.text: {T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um {W} oder {B}. Diese Karte zählt als Ebene und als Sumpf und unterliegt Zaubersprüchen, die für diese beiden Standard-Länder gelten. Zerstört ein Zauberspruch eines dieser Standard-Länder, wird diese Karte zerstört; verändert ein Zauberspruch eines dieser Standard-Länder, bleibt das andere Standard-Land davon unberührt.

cards.originalText:
ocT: Add either oW or oB to your mana pool.
Counts as both plains and swamp and is affected by spells that affect either. If a spell destroys one of these land types, this card is destroyed; if a spell alters one of these land types, the other land type is unaffected.

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

foreignNames.name: Waldfeen
foreignNames.text: Können fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

foreignNames.name: Seeschlange
foreignNames.text: Die Schlange kann nur angreifen, wenn der Gegner Inseln im Spiel hat. Wenn Du zu irgendeiner Zeit keine Inseln mehr im Spiel hast, geht die Schlange direkt auf den Friedhof.

cards.originalText: Serpent cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. Serpent is buried immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Sedge Troll
cards.text:
Sedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
{B}: Regenerate Sedge Troll.
cards.flavor: The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.
cards.originalText:
ooB Regenerates.
While controller has swamps in play, Sedge Troll gains +1/+1.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

foreignNames.name: Sengir-Vampir
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Lege jedes Mal eine +1/+1-Spielmarke auf den Vampir, wenn ein Wesen, dem er in diesem Zug Schaden zugefügt hat, auf dem Friedhof landet.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Vampire gets a +1/+1 counter each time a creature dies during a turn in which Vampire damaged it.

cards.name: Serendib Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.

foreignNames.name: Serendib-Ifrit
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Der Ifrit fügt Dir während Deiner Versorgungsphase 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Serendib Efreet does 1 damage to you during your upkeep.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Serra Angel to tap.

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

foreignNames.name: Dryaden aus dem Shanodin
foreignNames.text: Waldtarnung

cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

foreignNames.name: Zersplittern
foreignNames.text: Zerstört ein Zielartefakt.

cards.originalText: Shatter destroys target artifact.

cards.name: Shatterstorm
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

foreignNames.name: Zerschmetternder Sturm
foreignNames.text: Alle Artefakte im Spiel landen auf den Friedhof.

cards.originalText: All artifacts in play are buried.

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

foreignNames.name: Shivan-Drache
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
{R}: +1/+0 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText: Flying, ooR +1/+0

cards.name: Simulacrum
cards.text: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.

rulings.text: You can’t use Simulacrum on Loss of Life, just damage.
This is not damage prevention or redirection. It actually is life gain and newly dealt damage.
Simulacrum is the source of the damage. If an effect needs to know a characteristic of the damage’s source (Protection from Black, for instance), it will see the damage coming from Simulacrum.

foreignNames.name: Simulakrum
foreignNames.text: Alle Schadenspunkte, die Dir bislang in diesem Zug zugefügt worden sind, werden rückwirkend auf eine Deiner Kreaturen gelenkt. Falls Du in diesem Zug weiteren Schaden erleidest, wird dieser allerdings ganz normal behandelt.

cards.originalText: All damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. Even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature, you don't suffer any of it. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

cards.name: Siren's Call
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.
Creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.
At the beginning of the next end step, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.

rulings.text: It will require creatures with Haste to attack since they are able, but it won’t destroy them if they don’t for some reason.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can’t do so legally.
This will destroy creatures that weren’t able to attack because they had been previously tapped.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

foreignNames.name: Lockruf der Sirenen
foreignNames.text: Sämtliche Kreaturen des Gegners, die angreifen könnten, müssen angreifen. Alle Kreaturen, die es nicht tun und keine Mauern sind, werden am Ende der Spielrunde vernichtet. Dieser Spontanzauber kann nur gespielt werden, wenn der Gegner am Ende des Zuges ist, und nur vor seiner Angriffsphase. Kreaturen, die während dieser Runde heraufbeschworen wurden, bleiben vom Lockruf der Sirenen verschont.

cards.originalText: All of opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. Any non-wall creatures that cannot attack are killed at end of turn. Can be played only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Creatures summoned this turn are unaffected by Siren's Call.

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: You can’t Sleight proper nouns (i.e. card names). This means that you can’t affect a “Black Vise”.
Can target a card with no color words on it.
Can’t change a color word to the same color word. It must be a different word.
Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

foreignNames.name: Geniestreich
foreignNames.text: Ändere den Text eines Zielspruchs oder einer bleibenden Karte Deiner Wahl, indem Du eine Farbe durch eine andere ersetzt. Du kannst so z.B. "Neutralisiert roten Zauberspruch" durch "Neutralisiert schwarzen Zauberspruch" ersetzen. Die Manasymbole können durch den Geniestreich allerdings nicht vertauscht werden.

cards.originalText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one color word with another. For example, you can change "Counters red spells" to "Counters black spells." Sleight of Mind cannot change mana symbols.

cards.name: Smoke
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

rulings.text: Animated lands are affected by this spell. If on the battlefield with an effect that limits the number of land you untap, untapping an animated land will count as the one creature and the one land you can untap... thereby limiting you to one thing to be untapped.

foreignNames.name: Rauch
foreignNames.text: Jeder Spieler kann während seiner Enttap-Phase nur eine einzige Kreatur enttappen.

cards.originalText: Each player can only untap one creature during his or her untap phase.

cards.name: Sol Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.

foreignNames.name: Sonnenring
foreignNames.text: {T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um 2 farblose Mana. Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber.

cards.originalText: ocT: Add 2 colorless mana to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Sorceress Queen
cards.text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: Hexenkönigin
foreignNames.text: {T}: Ändere den Wert einer anderen Kreatur Deiner Wahl bis zum Ende des Zuges auf 0/2.

cards.originalText: ocT: Make another creature 0/2 until end of turn. Treat this exactly as if the numbers in the lower right of the target card were 0/2. All special characteristics and enchantments on the creature are unaffected.

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

foreignNames.name: Seelennetz
foreignNames.text: {1}: Für jede Kreatur, die aus dem Spiel heraus auf dem Friedhof landet, erhältst Du 1 Lebenspunkt. Du kannst diese Eigenschaft nur einmal pro Kreatur anwenden.

cards.originalText: o1: You gain 1 life every time a creature is placed in the graveyard. Can only give 1 life each time a creature is placed in the graveyard.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don’t affect a spell’s converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast’s mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you’ll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast’s X and pay {9}{U}.

foreignNames.name: Zauberspruchexplosion
foreignNames.text: Der Zielzauber wird abgewehrt, wobei X für die Kosten des Zielzaubers steht.

cards.originalText: Target spell is countered; X is casting cost of target spell.

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

rulings.text: Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won’t happen.
Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

foreignNames.name: Starre
foreignNames.text: Alle Spieler erhalten keine Enttap-Phase mehr. Bezahle {U} während Deiner Versorgungsphase oder vernichte die Starre.

cards.originalText: Players do not get an untap phase. Pay oU during your upkeep or Stasis is destroyed; cards still do not untap until the next untap phase.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

rulings.text: Can be used on artifact creatures.

foreignNames.name: Artefaktdiebstahl
foreignNames.text: Übernimm die Herrschaft über das verzauberte Artefakt.

cards.originalText: You control target artifact until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target artifact was tapped when stolen, it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target artifact is put in its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Stone Giant
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: What goes up, must come down.

rulings.text: If the Giant’s power and/or toughness change so that its toughness is less than its power, you can have the ability target the Giant itself.
To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won’t change that.

If Stone Giant’s ability is activated during a turn’s end step, the delayed triggered ability won’t trigger until the beginning of the next turn’s end step. The targeted creature will be destroyed at that time.

When the delayed triggered ability resolves, the targeted creature is destroyed, even if it’s no longer a creature, no longer under your control, or no longer has toughness less than Stone Giant’s power at that time.

foreignNames.name: Steinriese
foreignNames.text: {T}: Eine Zielkreatur, deren Widerstandskraft kleiner als die Stärke des Steinriesen sein muß, erhält bis zum Ende der Runde Flugfähigkeit. Vernichte diese Kreatur am Ende des Zuges. Andere Effekte können später die Widerstandskraft dieser Kreatur über die Stärke des Riesen hinaus erhöhen.

cards.originalText: ocT: Make one of your own creatures a flying creature until end of turn. Target creature, which must have toughness less than Stone Giant's power at the time it gains flying ability, is killed at end of turn.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

foreignNames.name: Steinhagel
foreignNames.text: Zerstöre ein Gelände.

cards.originalText: Destroys any one land.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.

foreignNames.name: Lebensquelle
foreignNames.text: Du oder ein anderer Spieler Deiner Wahl erhält X Lebenspunkte dazu.

cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Sunglasses of Urza
cards.text: You may spend white mana as though it were red mana.

foreignNames.name: Urzas Sonnenbrille
foreignNames.text: Weißes Mana in Deinem Manavorrat kannst Du nach Belieben entweder als weißes oder rotes Mana verwenden.

cards.originalText: White mana in your mana pool can be used as either white or red mana.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oB to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: ocT: Add oB to your mana pool.
